title: Labor Day, 2025
summary: Proclamation 10968, issued by President Donald J. Trump on August 28, 2025, designates September 1, 2025, as Labor Day. The proclamation honors the contributions and resilience of American workers, highlighting their pivotal role in shaping the nation's history and economy. It acknowledges past declines in manufacturing and job losses but emphasizes the current administration's efforts to restore American manufacturing, protect jobs, and secure fair trade deals. The proclamation calls on all public officials and citizens to observe Labor Day with appropriate ceremonies and activities that celebrate working Americans. It underscores the administration's commitment to defending American jobs and the dignity of labor, ensuring workers keep more of their earnings and fostering new opportunities in communities across the country.
